title: How to reset (or recover) all email accounts
content:
I have TB 145.0 on a Mac.

When my trash gets pretty full, I empty the trash then restart TB just to have a fresh start. Been doing this for years. Well, I did it just now and when TB restarted I got a warning that said Thunderbird is an app I downloaded from the internet, do I trust it? First time that has happened.d I clicked on the button that said to go ahead and open it.

When TB opened, it wasn't aware of any of my email accounts. It's almost like I was opening it for the first time – except for 187 random old emails in an inbox.

Is there a way to recover from this? I had a lot of emails stored in inboxes and outboxes that would be disastrous for me to lose. They aren't there right now.
creator: clintoconner2

title: Message Filter seems empty
content:
Environment:

  • Thunderbird: 146.0.1 (aarch64)
  • macOS: 26.2
  • Language: Japanese version

I have been using Message Filters to organize my emails into various folders. One week ago, I added a new email account to Thunderbird. Today I tried to set up filters for the new account in the same way, but they are not working. Specifically, the "Condition" and "Action" columns in the Message Filter window are completely empty. Furthermore, I noticed that columns in the filters settings for my original email account also seem empty as shown in the attached screenshot. Even the filter setting looks empty, the original setting seems working correctly. I have uninstall and re-install Thunderbird, but it does not fix the issue. Could you please guide me on how to resolve this issue?

I greatly appreciate the community's support.
creator: tet.suzaki.oregon

title: Attachment Full-Text Search in Thunderbird (Email Indexing)
content:
Hello Thunderbird team,

We are an organisation that recently migrated from another email client to Thunderbird. Overall the client has been fast and easy to use, but we have identified a key functionality gap that impacts our day-to-day operations.

Previously we relied heavily on the ability to search not only in email body text but also inside PDF attachment contents (e.g., specific keywords within attached PDF files). In Thunderbird this capability is currently missing, existing search and add-ons (e.g., Expression Search – NG, etc.) do not index or find text inside PDFs.

This feature is critical for business users that need to locate emails based on text inside attachments. We would like to request that full-text search of common attachment types (PDF, Word documents, etc.) be considered for inclusion in a future Thunderbird release, ideally with options for indexing and performance controls.

If this is already on the roadmap, we would appreciate any guidance on how to enable it or track progress. If not, we would be grateful if the team could evaluate this enhancement.

Thanks for your work on Thunderbird and wishing you a happy new year!
creator: ellinasandreas2001

title: Apply current view of message list pane to other folders not working

I like to copy my message list pane view settings to all or some other folders. I'm using the option given at the bottom of the pulldown menu when hovering over the title line of message pane. It's not working for me, not on folders and its children, nor on folders only. I have this problem already ever since I noticed the option doing. title: Mailinglijsten worden niet gesynchroniseerd
content:
Ik ben aan het overstappen van Gmail naar een eigen account bij een betaalde e-mailprovider en wil daarbij Thunderbird gebruiken. Mijn contacten staan inmiddels op de server van mijn nieuwe provider en worden naar Thunderbird gesynchroniseerd via een caldav-koppeling. De losse contacten komen keurig over naar Thunderbird, maar de mailgroepen niet. Hetzelfde geldt voor de groepen in mijn Google contacts (gaat in de toekomst vervallen). Ik heb ook nog een Outlook-acclount en maak daarvoor gebruik van de add-on 'Uil voor Excange'. Daar komen de mailgroepen wel over.

Ik doe hetzelfde op mijn Android apparaten, daar zijn de groepen wel aanwezig in de contactenlijst.

Het bijzondere is dat ik de menuoptie 'bestand -> nieuw -> mailinglijst' zoals genoemd in https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/mailinglijsten-aanmaken-gebruiken niet heb. Ook is het ikoontje voor 'Een nieuwe e-maillijst maken' bovenin het venster met de adresboeken uitgegrijsd als het 'caldav'-adresboek of het Gmail-adresboek geselecteerd is.

Ik maak gebruik van Thunderbird versie 140.5.0esr onder Ubuntu 24.04.3.

Wat doe ik niet goed?
creator: geertbruijnes

title: On Dec 17 2025 Thunderbird stopped bringing emails in and out, but is connected to email server
content:
I successfully installed Thunderbird version 146.01 in November 2025 and successfully completed the connection to my email server Comcast.net. With all folders downloaded I proceeded to receive and send emails without any issues until around December 17 2025 when Thunderbird stopped receiving or sending emails. I performed all the steps listed without success, When I test the connection in settings I get the following: "Successfully established a secure connection to imap.comcast.net:995." Yet I get no emails

I see a Thunderbird update came in around December 17 2025, maybe a coincidence? Thank you Ed

title: Old Emails Disappeared After Repair
content:
Good day all,

I had some old emails stored in a Local folder.

While I could see the the header information shows up in the view panel (from address, subject, date, etc), I could NOT see the contents of the email (the preview window is entirely blank), and attempting to copy the email failed.

I completed the 1st Repair detailed in this link as it seemed to be the exact same issue: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1515421

When It was completed, all except four of the old emails disappeared. The four remaining files can be opened & read (so the repair worked on those four).

Examining the Inbox mbox file as explained in Repair #2 (link above) showed only the data for the four remaining files.

My question - does anyone know of a way to 1) restore the emails that vanished?, and 2) after restoring the emails that vanished, how to be able to read them?

I have a back-up of the entire profile that was made before the repair - so I can pull specific files from that back-up and "start over" if need be.

Thx!
creator: nedoking2000

title: thunderbird flatpak on ubuntu 24.04 severely crashed
content: Hi, I setup an ubuntu 24.04 and used the default flatpak installation of thunderbird- I believe 146- via the software app, so it took a default option. Worked a few hours, then suddenly one of the 3 email accounts on outlook365 blocked sending, no messages. I tried to use some Delete "Start-Cache" option from thunderbird, and then it was no longer able to to boot, and hung up everytime. I had to delete it completely, and the user profile was gone. Not sure if an issue of Ubuntu 24.04 or of the latest Thunderbird on flatpak..I also have no error logs left, those where also deleted with the deinstallation. Ubuntu should go a version back. I meanwhile found some installation pathes for an ".deb" file and hope that will be more smooth. (I work since many years on thunderbird on my PC & Mac with no such problems ever- so this is very new) best regards, Philipp Fonberg, redacted@gmx.ch
creator: former12
